DOC.brief_title: Randomized Clinical Trial Rehabilitation Subacromial Impingement Syndrome
DOC.detailed_description: Subacromial impingement syndrome ( SAIS ) frequent cause shoulder pain . Clinical trial investigate effectiveness manual therapy demonstrate improvement outcomes manual therapy add program therapeutic exercise . However , clinical trial ( 3 ) significant limitation generalizability . Two three 3 trial small number subject ( 14 & 22 subject ) 3 trial short term follow ( < 12 week ) use non-validated self report outcome measure . These limitation reduce confidence clinician apply result patient treat SAIS . Clear evidence need justify cost clinician time require perform manual therapy delivery patient care . Therefore , purpose randomized clinical trial examine short-term long-term effectiveness manual therapy addition therapeutic exercise compare therapeutic exercise patient diagnose SAIS .

Reproduction symptom impingement test : either Hawkins Kennedy Neer Test 2 . Pain active shoulder elevation 60 degree 3 . Weakness rotator cuff pain Empty Can test resist shoulder external rotation Shoulder disability : 25/100 ( 0 = disability ) Able understand write speak Severe pain ; pain > 7/10 NPRS ( 0 = pain ) Shoulder surgery affect shoulder Traumatic shoulder dislocation within past 3 month Previous rehabilitation episode shoulder pain Reproduction shoulder pain active passive cervical motion Systemic inflammatory joint disease Global loss passive shoulder ROM , indicative adhesive capsulitis Fullthickness rotator cuff tear , evidence one following : 1 . Markedly reduce shoulder external rotation strength 2 . Drop arm test 3 . External rotation lag sign 4 . Lift test 5 . Positive finding MRI ultrasonography
